Nad added the country also sent 120mm artillery ammunition and fuel.

175.title: Sudan's key pro-democracy groups release 1st political charter
175.article_body: The main pro-democracy groups of Sudan on Sunday released a political charter for the first time, aiming to unify factions and bring democracy. As per charter, an appointed PM will serve as head of state and military commander-in-chief for a transition period of 2 years until a constitution is ratified. Sudan plunged into crisis after military coup in October 2021.

176.title: Estée Lauder fires senior exec Demsey for posting racist meme on Instagram
176.article_body: The Estée Lauder Companies has fired Executive Group President John Demsey for posting a meme on his Instagram account that contained a racial slur and a joke about COVID-19. The company said Demsey's Instagram posts caused "widespread offence". Demsey, who oversees brands like Clinique and Mac, had apologised last week for "carelessly reposting a racist meme without reading it beforehand."

177.title: Heroin worth ₹70 lakh seized in Haryana, 9 arrested
177.article_body: Haryana Police has arrested nine people from Jind and Sirsa districts in separate cases and seized heroin worth around ₹70 lakh from them. Of the total 669 grams seized, 514 grams of heroin was recovered from two of the accused near Belarkhan village. Preliminary probe revealed the drugs were to be supplied in Narwana, Sangrur and Patiala areas, police said.

178.title: Switzerland bans entry of 5 Russian oligarchs close to Putin
178.article_body: Swiss Justice Minister Karin Keller-Sutter on Monday said government banned five Russian oligarchs close to Russian President Vladimir Putin from entering the country. This comes after the neutral nation adopted sanctions imposed by EU against Russia after it mounted a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24. However, the minister did not name the oligarchs citing privacy concerns.

179.title: Filmmaker Luv Ranjan shares first pics of wedding with Alisha
179.article_body: Filmmaker Luv Ranjan on Monday took to social media to share the first pictures of his wedding with his longtime girlfriend Alisha Vaid. The couple got married on February 20 in Agra. Their wedding was attended by actors Kartik Aaryan, Ranbir Kapoor, Shraddha Kapoor, Rakul Preet Singh, Jackky Bhagnani, Arjun Kapoor and Varun Sharma, among others.

180.title: Ukraine to pay its soldiers ₹2.5 lakh per month for fighting Russian troops
180.article_body: Ukraine has announced that its soldiers will be paid 100,000 hryvnias per month (around ₹2.5 lakh) for defending against Russian forces. Families of deceased servicemen will be paid a lump sum amount of 15 million UAH (around ₹3.7 crore). As per the President, this isn't done to be thanked but to tell the defenders that Ukraine is grateful to them.

181.title: Sick, filthy: Gauahar on channel saying she fought with Shibani over Farhan
181.article_body: Gauahar Khan has criticised a news channel for reporting that she fought with Shibani Dandekar over a crush on Farhan Akhtar calling it filthy and sick. "Be...absolutely ashamed that in a time [of] war...some parts of...media...can't stop lying," she tweeted. Gauahar further wrote that she said all contestants of reality show 'I Can Do That' were crushing on host Farhan.

182.title: BSF airlifts 3 patients from J&K's snow-covered Kupwara
182.article_body: Three patients requiring immediate medical attention were airlifted by BSF from J&K's snow-covered Kupwara district on Monday. The Public Relations Officer of Kashmir Frontier said the district administration had made a special request for their evacuation as the only road passing through Sadhna top was closed. "We're always there to serve people of Kashmir," IG of BSF Kashmir said.

183.title: After calling Vikrant 'cockroach', Kangana wishes him on marrying a Himachali
183.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut wished actor Vikrant Massey on marrying Sheetal Thakur on Instagram, commenting, "Hmm Vikrant ji marrying a Himachali girl is good karma. Wish you both a happy married life." She had earlier called Vikrant a 'cockroach' after he commented on actress Yami Gautam's picture dressed in traditional Himachali bridal attire writing, "Pure and pious like Radhe Maa."

184.title: Delhi HC refuses to entertain plea to change title of 'Prithviraj'
184.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday refused to entertain a plea seeking to modify the title of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj'. The bench of judges said that they were inclined to dismiss the plea with costs after which the plea was withdrawn. The submitted plea had stated that Prithviraj was a great emperor and the title should be more respectful.

185.title: Don't feed stray dogs, monkeys on court premises: Delhi High Court
185.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday directed advocates, litigants, staff members and security personnel to not feed stray animals like monkeys and dogs within its premises. The court said that it had come to notice that some advocates, litigants, staff members and security personnel were still feeding stray animals in spite of directions issued against it.

186.title: Luxembourg to send anti-tank weapons to Ukraine amid war with Russia
186.article_body: Luxembourg Defence Minister François Bausch on Monday said the government will send 100 NLAW anti-tank weapons, jeeps and 15 military tents to Ukraine. This comes after EU on Sunday decided to fund military weapons for Ukraine to help it defend itself against Russian invasion. At least 352 civilians including 14 children were killed since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

187.title: New Zealand to end quarantine curbs for vaccinated arrivals
187.article_body: New Zealand is set to end quarantine curbs for vaccinated nationals returning to the country from Thursday onwards, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has said. Incoming travellers will still need to test negative for COVID-19 before leaving and after arriving. The revised rule, however, does not include tourists as New Zealand hasn't opened its borders for international tourism yet.

188.title: Putin is a warmonger, tyrant & also kind of a huge b***h: John Oliver
188.article_body: Talking about Russian President Vladimir Putin, comedian John Oliver said, "He's an autocrat, a tyrant, a warmonger. But also, he's kinda...huge b***h." Oliver's comments were in response to a video of the security meeting where Putin ordered Russia's Foreign Intelligence Service chief Sergei Naryshkin to "speak plainly" on the matter of recognising Donetsk and Luhansk as 'People's Republics'.

189.title: PM Modi chairs 3rd high-level meeting in 24 hours on Russia-Ukraine conflict
189.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held the third high-level meeting within 24 hours on the Russia-Ukraine conflict, on Monday evening. The meeting was attended by External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar along with Union Ministers Jyotiraditya Scindia, Kiren Rijiju, Hardeep Puri and VK Singh. Scindia, Rijiju, Puri and Singh will be sent to Ukraine's neighbouring nations to oversee Indians' evacuation.

190.title: 8 yrs ago, universe did us a solid: Ankita on anniversary with Milind
190.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor-model Milind Soman's wife Ankita Konwar shared pictures with the actor to mark eight years of togetherness. "On this day, eight years ago, the universe did us a solid and it continues to work its charm every single day," she captioned the post. Milind and Ankita got married in April 2018 after dating for five years.

191.title: Moldova new land route to evacuate Indians stuck in Ukraine: MEA
191.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs on Monday said a new route through Moldova has been identified for evacuation of Indian nationals stranded in Ukraine. MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said the new route is operational and the Ministry's team is ready to assist those in need. "They will assist in the evacuation of Indians through Romania," Bagchi said.

192.title: Let's not politicise the evacuation process: Ex-PM Devegowda
192.article_body: Former Prime Minister HD Devegowda on Monday said the evacuation of Indians stuck in Ukraine must not be politicised. "It will demoralise those conducting the operation. Scoring points at this hour of crisis will make us look bad," Devegowda said. "It is only fair that we support our officers and embassies to focus on the job at hand," he added.

193.title: BJP crossed majority mark in UP after 5 phases of polls: Shah
193.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday claimed the BJP has already gone past the majority mark after the first five phases of polling in the Uttar Pradesh elections. "In the sixth and seventh phases, people have to vote for the BJP to form the government with over 300 seats," he said at an election rally.

194.title: 15 booked after Panchkula trader ends life in Ludhiana hotel
194.article_body: The Ludhiana Police on Sunday booked 15 persons for abetment to suicide after a Panchkula-based trader ended his life over being allegedly harassed by his business associates. Sub-Inspector Jaskanwal Singh Sekhon said the victim was found dead in his hotel room on February 25. The police had found two pills and a suicide note from his room.

195.title: Urgent to end talks to revive Iran nuclear deal this week: France
195.article_body: France's Foreign Ministry on Monday said that it is urgent to end negotiations to revive a 2015 nuclear deal between world powers and Iran this week. The talks are being held in Austria's Vienna. Separately, Iran said that efforts to revive the deal could succeed if the US took a political decision to meet its demands.

196.title: Russian President Putin calls West an 'Empire of Lies' after sanctions
196.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin called the West an "Empire of Lies" following the economic sanctions imposed by countries like the UK and those in EU. "PM Mikhail Mishustin and I discussed this...bearing in mind the sanctions the so-called Western community...as I called it in my speech, the 'empire of lies' - is now trying to implement against Russia," Putin said.

197.title: Don't be aggressive at railway stations: Advisory for Indians stuck in Ukraine
197.article_body: The Indian embassy in Ukraine requested Indian nationals, students stuck amid war to "remain calm, peaceful and united". Warning of large crowds at railway stations, the embassy advisory said, "It's advised that all Indian students remain patient, composed and especially not to exhibit aggressive behaviours while at the railway stations." Delays in trains and cancellations are expected, it added.

198.title: How much prize money did PSL 2022 winners get as compared to IPL 2021?
198.article_body: Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2022 winners Lahore Qalandars won a cash prize of PKR 80,000,000 (around ₹3.4 crore), while Indian Premier League 2021 champions Chennai Super Kings had won ₹20 crore. Further PSL 2022 runners-up Multan Sultans got a cash prize of PKR 32,000,000 (₹1.37 crore), while IPL 2021 runners-up KKR received a prize money of ₹12.5 crore.

199.title: 3-day Urs of Shah Jahan begins at Taj Mahal in Agra
199.article_body: The three-day Urs of Mughal emperor Shah Jahan started at the Taj Mahal in Agra on Sunday. Portals of the Taj Mahal basement housing the original graves of Shah Jahan and his consort Mumtaz Mahal were opened for visitors on the occasion. Entry to Taj Mahal was free from 2 pm on Sunday and will remain the same on Monday.

200.title: One of the most amazing experiences: Watson on playing in Pakistan
200.article_body: Terming playing in Pakistan as one of the most "amazing" experiences of his life, ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said he was fortunate to play a few matches of Pakistan Premier League in the country. The 40-year-old represented Islamabad United and Quetta Gladiators in PSL. Meanwhile, Australia will be playing an all-format series in Pakistan after 24 years, beginning March 4.

201.title: TMC goons restricting my movement, can't perform duties: Cong MP
201.article_body: Congress' Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury wrote a letter to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla over alleged incidents of violence in West Bengal municipal polls, alleging that he's unable to perform his duties as MP. Chowdhury, who is MP from Berhampore, alleged that he is often heckled and mobbed by Trinamool Congress' (TMC) "goons". "My movement is completely restricted [here]," he added.

202.title: US bans transactions with Russian central bank, National Wealth Fund
202.article_body: The United States on Monday banned its citizens and companies from carrying out transactions with the Russian central Bank, the National Wealth Fund and the Ministry of Finance. The move will immobilise any Russian central bank assets held in the US, the country's Treasury department said. The US also announced penalties on the Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF).

203.title: World poverty to rise as climate change hits food supplies: UN panel
203.article_body: Experts from UN's Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) on Monday warned of a rise in global poverty as climate change and extreme weather will lead to reduced food production and increased food prices, if left unchecked. The report estimated up to 183 million additional people would become undernourished in low-income countries due to climate change by 2050.

204.title: Tanzanian plane with 14 people on board crashes off Comoros
204.article_body: A Tanzania-registered light aircraft with 14 passengers and crew on board crashed into the sea off Comoros on Saturday. Rescuers in the Indian Ocean archipelago have launched a search for the missing passengers and crew, local authorities said. "As long as we have not found any bodies, there is hope," a senior police official said.

205.title: UAE's flydubai suspends flights to Russia, Ukraine and Belarus
205.article_body: United Arab Emirates airline flydubai on Monday suspended some flights to Russia, Ukraine and Belarus up to March 8. As per a notice posted on its website, the carrier banned flights to Krasnodar, Rostov-on-Don, Kiev, Odessa and Minsk. This comes after Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24 killing at least 352 civilians including 14 children.

206.title: Ukrainian singer joins army, sings on deserted Kyiv street; video goes viral
206.article_body: Ukrainian singer Andriy Khlyvnyuk has volunteered to join the army to fight the Russian troops. In a video shared by the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Khlyvnyuk could be seen dressed in military attire, holding a gun and singing a folk song on an empty street in Kyiv. Khlyvnyuk is the lead singer of the BoomBox band.

207.title: China's Long March-8 rocket launches record 22 satellites in space
207.article_body: China's Long March-8 rocket on Sunday set a new domestic record by sending 22 satellites in space in a single flight. Made by seven institutes and private companies, the satellites were deployed for commercial remote sensing services, marine environment monitoring, forest fire prevention and disaster mitigation. The rocket was launched from Wenchang Spacecraft Launch Site in Hainan province.

208.title: Delhi govt discontinues discounts on MRP of liquor, cites crowding issue
208.article_body: The Delhi government’s excise department on Monday ordered discontinuation of discounts on MRP of liquor. In its order, the department said that while the discounts were intended to promote healthy competition and consumer choice, it also led to large crowds outside stores, which can aggravate COVID-19 cases. It added that the discounting also led to unhealthy market practices.

209.title: 224 new COVID cases, 11 deaths reported in B'luru in last 24 hours
209.article_body: Bengaluru Urban has reported 224 new COVID-19 cases in the state of Karnataka in the last 24 hours. The city also recorded 326 recoveries, or people being discharged on Sunday along with 11 virus-related deaths. Bengaluru Urban district now stands at a total of 17,78,361 coronavirus cases.

210.title: Cyberabad Police to auction over 600 abandoned vehicles, list shared
210.article_body: Cyberabad Police has announced that it'll be auctioning over 600 abandoned or unclaimed vehicles of various types and make. The vehicles are currently pooled at Pahadi Shareef PS Ground, Hyderabad. The force released list of total 621 vehicles and asked people, who might've objections or ownership interest in any of the vehicles to file an application and claim the vehicle.

211.title: Can't get over Alia's brilliant performance: Basu on 'Gangubai...'
211.article_body: Taking to Twitter, filmmaker Anurag Basu wrote, "It's been three days I have seen 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and I can't get over Alia's brilliant performance." He further added that the film's director, Sanjay Leela Bhansali, has reinstated his big screen magic again. In another tweet, Basu said that 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' is cinematographer Sudeep Chatterjee's best work to date.

212.title: G7 leaders to hold call with NATO and EU chiefs amid war in Ukraine
212.article_body: The leaders of G7 nations will hold a call with the Secretary General of NATO, EU chiefs and leaders of Romania and Poland on Monday, Italy said. Later, the European Commission President and leaders of Italy, France and Germany will hold a call, Itay added. Notably, Poland and Romania share a border with Ukraine, which has been invaded by Russia.

213.title: Dozens killed, hundreds hurt in Russian rocket strikes on Ukraine's Kharkiv
213.article_body: Dozens of people were killed in rocket strikes by Russia on the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv on Monday, Ukrainian Interior Ministry Adviser Anton Herashchenko said. Hundreds have been wounded in the strikes, Herashchenko said. This came even as peace talks between Ukraine and Russia started at the Belarusian border.

214.title: DGCA extends ban on regular commercial int'l passenger flights
214.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Monday extended the suspension of scheduled international commercial passenger flights to/from India till further orders. This restriction doesn't apply to international all-cargo operations, DGCA-approved flights and flights under air-bubble arrangement. The ban on scheduled international passenger flights has been in place since March 23, 2020.

215.title: My most memorable wicket was of Kohli, I knocked him over: O' Keefe
215.article_body: Australia spinner Steve O'Keefe has revealed dismissing Virat Kohli in first Test of 2017 Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Pune is his "most memorable" wicket. "I knocked him over, we were playing on this absolute dust bowl of a wicket, it was spinning...Ravi Shastri described the wicket of having dermatitis...it had holes in it," he added. O'Keefe took 12/70 in the Test.

216.title: 6th evacuation flight from Budapest with 240 Indians reaches Delhi
216.article_body: The sixth evacuation flight from Hungary's capital Budapest carrying 240 Indian nationals stranded in Ukraine landed at the Delhi airport on Monday. Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi welcomed the Indian nationals at the airport. The Central Government has launched Operation Ganga to bring back Indians stranded in Ukraine.

217.title: Over 5 lakh have fled Ukraine since start of Russian invasion: UN
217.article_body: Over 5 lakh people have fled Ukraine since the start of Russia's invasion of the country last week, the UN refugee agency said on Monday. Of these, 2.81 lakh people have arrived in Poland, a UN spokeswoman said. Similarly, Hungary, Moldova, Romania and Slovakia have welcomed more than 84,500, about 36,400, over 32,500 and around 30,000 people from Ukraine, respectively.

218.title: Everyone wants Ranbir's response to 'Gangubai Kathiawadi': Alia
218.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, on being asked about her boyfriend actor Ranbir Kapoor's reaction to 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', said, "Sabko Ranbir ka response chahiye (Everyone wants Ranbir's response)." The actress further said that she will try to convince Ranbir to give a byte for the movie because he is not on social media. "How can I give his response?" Alia added.

219.title: Czech Republic supports Ukraine's bid to join EU: PM Fiala
219.article_body: Czech Republic supports Ukraine's efforts to join the European Union (EU), Czech PM Petr Fiala was quoted as saying by local media on Monday. It's necessary to give a clear signal that Ukraine is welcome in the European community of democratic countries, he added. This comes amid Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's request for a fast-track membership to the bloc.

220.title: Russia closes its airspace to 36 countries including UK and Germany
220.article_body: Russia on Monday barred airlines from 36 countries including Britain, Germany, Spain, Italy and Canada from using Russian airspace. Russia's state aviation agency said that planes from these countries could only enter Russia's airspace with special permission. The move follows a decision by the EU and Canada over the weekend to close their skies to the Russian planes.

221.title: India to send humanitarian aid including medicines to Ukraine
221.article_body: India will send humanitarian aid including medicines to Ukraine, the Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said on Monday. This came after India abstained from voting in the UNSC for a rare special emergency session of the UN General Assembly on the Russia-Ukraine conflict. India had earlier abstained from voting on a resolution condemning Russia.

222.title: Rahul Gandhi releases Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin's autobiography
222.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday released Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin's autobiography 'Ungalil Oruvan' (One Among You) in Chennai. Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan,  Leader of Opposition in Bihar Assembly Tejashwi Yadav and National Conference leader Omar Abdullah were also present. DMK leader Duraimurugan received the first copy of the book.

223.title: 86 kg marijuana seized from 10 peddlers in 3 cases in Bengaluru
223.article_body: Police have recovered 86 kg of ganja from ten peddlers in three different cases in Bengaluru. In one of the cases, the accused reportedly confessed to procuring around 80 kg marijuana at a lower price in Andhra Pradesh and allegedly selling it in Bengaluru at about ₹40,0000-50,000. About 3.5 and 2.5 kg of ganja was recovered in other two cases.

224.title: Hyderabad student arrested for buying 40 LSD blots from dark web
224.article_body: A Hyderabad Central University student was nabbed for allegedly buying 40 LSD blots from dark web on multiple occasions. The student is among several others, including IT professionals, a doctor and other students, arrested in a major drug bust involving three separate cases on Saturday. The Hyderabad Police ended up seizing drugs including MDMA, hash oil, ganja and LSD blots.

225.title: Supertech twin towers to be destroyed by May 22: Noida authority
225.article_body: Noida authority on Monday informed the Supreme Court that Supertech's twin 40-storey towers in its Emerald Court project will be demolished by May 22. The work on the demolition has already started, it said. The SC, on August 31, 2021, announced the demolition of the twin towers within three months for violation of building norms in "collusion with Noida officials."

226.title: Eaten only 3-4 spoons of rice in a day, we need help: Indian student in Ukraine
226.article_body: Speaking about her ordeal while being stuck in Ukraine, an Indian student said that she along with a few more students have eaten only three to four spoons of rice a day. She added, "We are roaming on the road and can meet with any fate. We need help." Another student has alleged harassment of female students by Ukrainian guards.

227.title: Hong Kong logs record over 34,000 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
227.article_body: Hong Kong authorities on Monday reported 34,466 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours, increasing by four times from a week ago. "Once every three days the case number will double," said Albert Au, Principal Medical and Health Officer. On the other hand, Hong Kong Health Minister Sophia Chan said the government was "still discussing" the matter of lockdown.

228.title: Dera chief Ram Rahim brought back to jail after end of furlough
228.article_body: Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh was brought back to Rohtak's Sunaria jail after the end of his 21-day furlough on Monday. He was granted the furlough to meet his family. Ram Rahim is serving a life term for the murder of his manager in 2002 and was also convicted for the rape of two women in 2017.

229.title: Qatar calls for diplomatic settlement between Ukraine and Russia
229.article_body: Qatar Foreign Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al-Thani called for a diplomatic settlement between Ukraine, Russia. In a speech at Human Rights Council in Geneva, Al-Thani backed a settlement which will preserve Ukraine's sovereignty, territorial integrity within its recognised boundaries. This comes as Russia launched an invasion of Ukraine on February 24 killing at least 352 people.

230.title: Inappropriate to compare Ukraine’s situation with ours: Taiwan
230.article_body: Taiwanese government said on Monday that it’s inappropriate for people to compare Ukraine’s situation with theirs. Taiwan has a natural barrier (Taiwan Strait) that separates it from China, Cabinet spokesperson Lo Ping-cheng said. These remarks come after UK PM Boris Johnson said that Western indifference to Russian aggression in Ukraine could lead to threat to Taiwan.

231.title: Sushant's death a tough test for my relationship with Ankita: Vicky
231.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande's husband Vicky Jain has said that the death of actor Sushant Singh Rajput was a tough test for their relationship. Ankita and Sushant were in a relationship for six years before breaking up in 2016. Vicky further said that he was proud of how Ankita handled herself after Sushant's death, adding that she fulfilled her responsibility.

232.title: 71% jump in PSL 2022 profits, most in its history: Ramiz Raja
232.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board Chairman Ramiz Raja said Pakistan Super League 2022 has witnessed a jump of 71% in profits, which is the most in the tournament's history. He added every franchise earned PKR 900 million (over $5 million), all before the first ball was even bowled. Lahore Qalandars defeated Multan Sultans by 42 runs to win their maiden PSL trophy.

233.title: Credit growth to industry rises to 6.4% in Jan 2022 from 0.7% in Jan 2021
233.article_body: Reserve Bank of India's data showed that India's credit growth to industry rose from 0.7% in January 2021 to 6.4% in January 2022. Credit growth to medium enterprises is pegged at 74.7% against 21.8% in January 2021. Credit growth to micro and small industries accelerated to 19.7% from 0.5% and credit to large industries rose to 0.5% against -0.2%.

234.title: Journey from Ukraine was hassle-free: B'luru students on return
234.article_body: Indians who returned to Bengaluru from Ukraine said they had a hassle-free journey due to efforts of Indian Embassy officials in Ukraine as well as in Hungary and Slovakia. A batch of 12 students from Karnataka has landed at the Bengaluru airport on Sunday. MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said as of now, six flights have arrived carrying around 1,400 Indians.

235.title: Even if you win Ballon d'Or 7 times, you've to adapt: Mbappe on Messi
235.article_body: Talking about Lionel Messi, Paris Saint-Germain forward Kylian Mbappe said, "I'm happy for him because we know he's adjusting to a new life, a new city and a new club." He added, "Even when you win Ballon d'Or seven times, you have to adapt too." Kylian opined that Messi is "getting better and better" at the club.

236.title: Adapting to Pak conditions will be challenge for Australia: Watson
236.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has said that he is "super excited" for the Australia tour of Pakistan. This is Australia's first tour of Pakistan since 1998. "I think it is going to be an exceptional challenge for the Australian team to try and adapt to the Pakistan conditions when they haven't been there for so long," Watson stated.

237.title: Go to West Ukraine but don't go directly to border: India to Indians in Ukraine
237.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs has advised Indians stuck in Ukraine to go to West Ukraine but not go directly to the borders. "There's rush there (at the borders), it'll take time. Go to nearby cities, seek shelter there," said MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi. "We're making arrangements there, our teams will help you. Don't panic, we have enough flights," he added.

238.title: Ukrainian man moves landmine with bare hands while smoking a cigarette
238.article_body: A video of a Ukrainian man moving a landmine with his bare hands while smoking a cigarette has gone viral on social media. Media outlet The New Voice of Ukraine tweeted, "A Ukrainian spotted a mine on the road...and didn't wait around for a bomb disposal unit." It added, "At great risk to life and limb, he removed the mine."

239.title: US closes embassy in Belarus, allows non-essential staff to leave Russia
239.article_body: The United States on Monday suspended operations at its Belarus embassy and allowed the non-essential staff and their families at the US Embassy in Russia to leave the country amid the situation in Ukraine. "We took these steps due to security and safety issues stemming from the unprovoked...attack by Russian military forces in Ukraine," said Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

240.title: Govt's fiscal deficit rises to 59% of FY22 target in Apr 2021-Jan 2022
240.article_body: The Centre's fiscal deficit rose to 58.9% of its FY22 target between April 2021 and January 2022, data by the Controller General of Accounts showed. In Budget 2021, the government had aimed for a fiscal deficit of 6.8% of the GDP in FY22. Centre's capital expenditure in April 2021-January 2022 recorded a 22% YoY rise to ₹4.42 lakh crore.

241.title: Woman loses ₹3.25 lakh in cyber fraud in Noida
241.article_body: A woman from Noida lost ₹3.25 lakh after a cyber fraudster stole her bank account details on the pretext of updating the know your customer (KYC) details of her phone number. The fraudster had asked the victim to pay ₹10 online to reactivate her phone services. Subsequently, the money was withdrawn from the victim's bank account.

242.title: Biocon Biologics acquires Viatris' biosimilars assets in ₹25,169 cr deal
242.article_body: India's largest biopharmaceutical firm Biocon Biologics Ltd (BBL) signed a pact with Viatris to acquire the latter's biosimilars business for up to $3.34 billion (₹25,169 crore) in cash and stock. Viatris will receive $2 billion (₹15,071 crore) in cash on closing of the transaction and up to $335 million (₹2,524 crore) as additional payments expected to be paid in 2024.

243.title: Too early to do that: Rajkumar on India looking beyond Kohli, Rohit in T20Is
243.article_body: Disagreeing with a suggestion of replacing Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in T20Is, Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said, "It's too early to do that." He added, "Rohit is a master player in T20s. On his day, he can single-handedly win games for the team...don't think wholesale changes are needed." Notably, India is on a 12-match winning streak in T20Is.

244.title: MLA Raja Bhaiya booked for thrashing SP worker amid UP elections
244.article_body: Kunda MLA Raghuraj Pratap Singh, also known as Raja Bhaiya, has been booked for thrashing a polling agent of the SP ahead of the sixth phase of the Uttar Pradesh elections. An FIR has been filed against Raja Bhaiya and 17 others at the Kunda police station. Provisions of the SC/ST Act and IPC sections have been invoked.

245.title: 5 khadi shops gutted as fire breaks out in Dalhousie market
245.article_body: Five khadi shops were burnt to ashes after a fire broke out at the Gandhi Chowk Market in Himachal Pradesh's Dalhousie on Monday. SDM Jagan Thakur said the cause of fire is being ascertained. Fire tenders were rushed to the spot and the blaze was brought under control in two hours. No loss of life was reported in the mishap.

246.title: Noida Police arrest 26-yr-old man for killing friend
246.article_body: Noida Police on Sunday arrested 26-year-old Chandra Bhan for killing his friend Sanjeev Kumar, who shared a rented accommodation with him in Noida's Phase 2. The police said that Kumar was in an illicit relationship with Bhan's wife. When Bhan came to know about the affair, he strangled Kumar and fled with his wife, the police added.

247.title: Former acting DGP Sanjay Pandey appointed new Mumbai Police chief
247.article_body: The Maharashtra government has appointed former Maharashtra acting Director General of Police Sanjay Pandey as the new Mumbai Police Commissioner. He has replaced Hemant Nagrale, who was given the post after Param Bir Singh was shunted as the Mumbai Police chief. Nagrale will now be the Managing Director of the Maharashtra State Security Corporation.

248.title: Ukraine shares video of drone strikes on Russian convoy, says 'Fear, enemies!'
248.article_body: The Ukrainian air force carried out two drone strikes on a Russian convoy of more than a dozen vehicles using Turkish-made Bayraktar TB2 drones. Footage of the strike was also released on social media. Sharing the video on Twitter, the Armed Forces of Ukraine wrote, "Fear, enemies! There will be no peace for you on our earth!"

249.title: India's GDP growth slows to 5.4% in Q3 of FY22 compared to 8.4% in Q2
249.article_body: India's GDP growth slowed down to 5.4% during the third quarter of 2021-2022 compared to 8.4% in the previous quarter, the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation said on Monday. It also estimated that India's GDP will likely grow by 8.9% in 2021-22. In its first advanced estimate, the government had estimated the GDP in 2021-22 to grow by 9.2%.

250.title: Former Rajya Sabha MP Yadlapati Venkata Rao passes away at 102
250.article_body: Former Rajya Sabha MP and veteran Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader Yadlapati Venkata Rao passed away at the age of 102 in Hyderabad on Monday. Rao, who was nominated to the Rajya Sabha in 1998, had previously served as Agriculture Minister in undivided Andhra Pradesh in the late 1970s. Rao was affiliated with Congress before he joined TDP in 1983.

251.title: Delhi man harasses colleague by making fake accounts, arrested
251.article_body: The Delhi Police's cyber cell on Sunday arrested a man for harassing and stalking his colleague by creating fake social media accounts in her name to send defamatory messages to her family and friends. The accused disclosed that he was in a relationship with the woman for the last 10 years, but later the woman started ignoring him, police said.

252.title: Around 1,400 Indians brought back to India from Ukraine on 6 flights: Govt
252.article_body: As many as 1,396 Indians have been brought back to India from Ukraine in six flights, the government said on Monday. Four flights have arrived from Bucharest (Romania) and two flights from Budapest (Hungary), Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. Around 8,000 Indians have left Ukraine since the current conflict with Russia began, he said.

253.title: Development of UP is my responsibility & priority: PM Modi in Ballia
253.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound UP's Ballia on Monday, PM Modi said that development of the state is his "responsibility and priority". "I have an emotional connect with Ballia as...scheme to provide free gas cylinders Ujjwala was launched from here," PM added. Ballia will vote in the sixth phase of UP Assembly elections, which will be held on March 3.

254.title: Airbnb to house up to 1 lakh Ukrainian refugees for free, says CEO
254.article_body: Airbnb will provide free short-term housing for up to 1 lakh refugees fleeing Ukraine amid Russian invasion, the startup's CEO Brian Chesky announced on Twitter. Airbnb's senior executives have written to the governments of Poland, Romania, Germany and Hungary offering their support for housing refugees. The housing will be funded by Airbnb, donors and hosts on the platform, Chesky said.

255.title: Kazakh firm blocks Russian TV stations over Russia-Ukraine war
255.article_body: Kazakhstan's Remstroyservice company on Monday blocked Russian TV stations over their coverage of Russian invasion of Ukraine. "We are against war and against war propaganda," said Shakhtinsk-based company. Remstroyservice added they are running Kazakh state TV instead of all major Russian stations. This comes after at least 352 people were killed after Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

256.title: Satellite pic shows 5-km long convoy of Russian troops deployed near Kyiv
256.article_body: A satellite picture released by Maxar Technologies showed an over 5-km long convoy of Russian troops comprising hundreds of military vehicles deployed near the Ukrainian capital Kyiv. The convoy contained fuel, logistics and armoured vehicles including tanks, infantry fighting vehicles and self-propelled artillery, Maxar Technologies said. Russia-Ukraine war entered its fifth day today.

257.title: Google Maps stops showing Ukraine's live traffic worldwide temporarily
257.article_body: Google has globally disabled the Google Maps traffic layer and live information on how busy places like stores and restaurants are in Ukraine. Google said the decision was taken for the safety of local communities in the country, after consulting with sources including regional authorities. Live traffic information remains available to drivers using its turn-by-turn navigation features in Ukraine.

258.title: Carry enough cash, ready to eat meals: Indian embassy to students in Ukraine
258.article_body: The Indian embassy in Ukraine has released a second advisory for its nationals stranded in the country amid the Russian invasion. Referring to the students, it asked them to carry their passports, enough cash, ready to eat meals and winter clothing. The embassy also appreciated the Ukrainian authorities for supporting the evacuation of Indian citizens during these "dangerous times".

259.title: Headmistress of DPS Faridabad arrested in student's suicide case
259.article_body: Faridabad Police on Sunday arrested the headmistress of Delhi Public School, Faridabad on the charge of abetment of suicide, days after a class 10 student died by suicide after allegedly being harassed over his sexuality. Police said that a note was recovered on Friday, in which the 16-year-old allegedly blamed the school and "higher authorities."

260.title: Amul increases price for milk across India by ₹2 per litre
260.article_body: Amul is increasing the price for its milk across India by ₹2 per litre. The increased price of Amul milk will be applicable from tomorrow, March 1. Amul said that it is increasing the price of milk due to an increase in the prices of energy, packaging, transportation cost and animal feed.

261.title: Probe war crimes in Ukraine: Lithuania to International Criminal Court
261.article_body: Lithuanian government announced on Monday that it will ask prosecutors in International Criminal Court to investigate war crimes in Ukraine due to Russian military offensive. "There's new material coming in every day, but we have enough of it by now to file...request," Lithuanian PM Ingrida Šimonytė said. At least 102 Ukrainian civilians have been killed since Russian invasion, UN said.

262.title: Mumbai man beats wife to death, tries to stage it as accident
262.article_body: A 27-year-old man in Mumbai's Dharavi, who beat his 22-year-old wife to death last week before trying to stage the crime as an accident, has been charged with her murder. The accused, Rahul Jaiswal, told doctors that she had fallen from the mezzanine floor and fell unconscious. However, a post-mortem reportedly led to the revelation that she had been killed.

263.title: Harshal is getting better and better since the IPL 2021: Zaheer
263.article_body: Ex-India fast bowler Zaheer Khan said Harshal Patel is "getting better and better" since the IPL 2021. "Harshal has played all the games...with consistency as well," he added. Harshal had won the Purple Cap in IPL 2021 after taking 32 wickets. In the recently concluded T20I series against West Indies and Sri Lanka, Harshal scalped five and two wickets, respectively.

264.title: I move on quick: Shreyas after his 3 half-centuries in SL T20I series
264.article_body: Talking about his current form, India batter Shreyas Iyer, who was adjudged 'Player of the Series' in T20I series against Sri Lanka, said he tries to move on quickly as people tend to forget the past performances. Shreyas scored three half-centuries (57*, 74*, 73*) in the series. Shreyas had scored 105 on his Test debut in Kanpur in November 2021.

265.title: BMC to install new bus shelters at 105 places in Mumbai suburbs
265.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will be replacing existing bus shelters with new ones at 105 locations in Mumbai's eastern and western suburbs as part of its Tactical Urbanism plan. The project aims to maximise use of public spaces to make them available for citizens. The new shelters will have transparent enclosures and movable metal benches clamped on the footpath.

266.title: Lufthansa cancels 30 flights to Russia amid Russia-Ukraine war
266.article_body: German flag airline, Lufthansa on Monday said they cancelled 30 flights of Lufthansa, Eurowings and Austrian Airlines carriers to Russia this week. This comes after the country on Saturday said it was preparing to shut its airspace to Russian planes. At least 352 people including 14 children were killed after Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

267.title: 800 protesters arrested in Belarus amid vote on non-nuclear status
267.article_body: Around 800 people have been arrested in Belarus as the country voted to revoke its non-nuclear status through a constitutional referendum vote, the Belarusian government said on Monday. Protesters had taken to the streets across Belarus and chanted anti-war slogans amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Belarus' vote came after Russia put its nuclear deterrent forces on high alert.

268.title: Mumbai-Navi Mumbai water taxi runs only 3 trips in 10 days
268.article_body: The first-ever water taxi service between Mumbai and Navi Mumbai has run only three trips in 10 days after inauguration on February 17. The CEO of Maharashtra Maritime Board, the nodal agency for the project, said a meeting will be held with all stakeholders to find a solution on March 2. A one-way ticket is priced between ₹800 to ₹1,200.

269.title: India's fourth COVID-19 wave may begin around June 22: IIT Kanpur study
269.article_body: The fourth wave of COVID-19 in India may start around June 22 and may peak from mid to late August, a modelling study by researchers at the IIT-Kanpur has indicated. The researchers, however, noted that a possible new variant of coronavirus may impact the whole analysis. The impact will depend on the possible variant's infectibility, fatality, etc, they said.

270.title: EU acting hostile, weapon supplies to Ukraine dangerous: Russia
270.article_body: Russia on Monday accused the European Union of acting hostile towards it and warned against the supply of weapons to Ukraine. "EU is acting in a hostile fashion towards us. Weapons' supplies to Ukraine are dangerous and destabilising," said Russia. This comes after the EU promised to finance the purchase and delivery of weapons and equipment to Ukraine.

271.title: Roman-era tombs from 1st century AD found at Gaza construction site
271.article_body: Construction workers unearthed Roman-era tombs from 2,000 years ago at a construction site in Beit Lahia, Gaza. Confirming the discovery, Naji Sarhan, spokesperson of Gaza's Ministry of Public Works said there are other graves at site. While construction has been halted at the site, experts from Gaza's Ministry of Antiquities and Tourism have been sent to inspect gravestones and artefacts.

272.title: Hong Kong mortuaries run out of space as COVID-19 deaths mount
272.article_body: The mortuaries in Hong Kong ran out of space to store bodies amid a surge in COVID-19 fatalities. According to Tony Ling, head of the city's Public Doctors Association, dozens of bodies are lying at hospitals waiting to be transported to mortuaries. "These bodies now need extra time to wait for collection because resources are just so tight," said Ling.

273.title: It'll be made, it's a dream: Bhushan on Gulshan Kumar biopic with Aamir
273.article_body: T-Series MD Bhushan Kumar said that 'Mogul', a film based on the life of his father and the company's founder Gulshan Kumar, will happen for sure. The biopic will feature Aamir Khan as Gulshan. "It'll be...little later...because Aamir sir's film (Laal Singh Chaddha) has been delayed...I'm in no hurry to make [it]...It's not...project for me, it's a dream," Bhushan said.

274.title: What a blast we had shooting: Shilpa Shetty on 25 yrs of 'Auzaar'
274.article_body: As film 'Auzaar' completed 25 years, actress Shilpa Shetty Kundra recalled working on the project. Taking to Instagram, Shilpa posted a video, which features a few scenes from the movie. She captioned it, "Working with friends never quite felt like work even back then. What a blast we had shooting #Auzaar...with such fabulous co-stars like @beingsalmankhan @sanjaykapoor2500."

275.title: Ukraine demands immediate ceasefire, withdrawal of Russian troops
275.article_body: Ukraine on Monday demanded an immediate ceasefire and withdrawal of the Russian troops from its territories. This comes as a Ukrainian delegation reached Belarusian town of Gomel to hold talks with the Russian counterpart. "The Ukrainian delegation arrived at the Ukrainian-Belarusian border to take part in talks with representatives of the Russian Federation," the Ukrainian presidency said.

276.title: Scientists reveal 4.4 million galaxies via radio telescope
276.article_body: A team of international scientists revealed an "astonishingly detailed" radio image of 4.4 million galaxies through Low Frequency Array (LOFAR), a pan-European radio telescope. The team used algorithms on high-performance computers across Europe to process observations lasting 3,500 hours. This release is only 27 per cent of the entire survey, said Timothy Shimwell of Leiden University.

277.title: Govt revises travel guidelines for Indians being evacuated from Ukraine
277.article_body: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW) on Monday revised its international travel advisory, providing certain exemptions to Indians being evacuated from war-hit Ukraine. Mandatory pre-boarding negative RT-PCR test report or full vaccination certificate have been exempted for Indians. Indians have also been exempted from uploading these documents on Air Suvidha portal before departure.

278.title: Salman threw his diary at me when I asked for 'Har Dil Jo...' dates: Sajid
278.article_body: Film producer Sajid Nadiadwala said he and actor Salman Khan got into an argument over dates for the film 'Har Dil Jo Pyar Karega'. Sajid said he told Salman the shooting was to begin in 20 days. "He threw his diary at me...I took diary and adjusted his dates. I cancelled few of his scheduled dates, added mine," he added.

279.title: A movie that slapped patriarchy: Taapsee on two years of 'Thappad'
279.article_body: As film 'Thappad' completed two years, actress Taapsee Pannu shared a post for the film. Sharing a video compilation of several glimpses from the film, Taapsee captioned it, "Celebrating two years of @anubhavsinhaa's Thappad, the movie that confidently called out the flawed societal norms and slapped patriarchy!" Actress Dia Mirza also shared the same video on her Instagram handle.

280.title: Shibani gets wedding date with Farhan tattooed, shares pics
280.article_body: Actress Shibani Dandekar has gotten her wedding date with actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar tattooed on the back of her left forearm in Roman numerals which reads XXI.II.XXII. The couple got married on February 19 at a private ceremony in Khandala. Shibani had gotten Farhan's name tattooed on her neck as a birthday gift to him last year.

281.title: Diljit, Arjun Rampal to star in Honey's film based on true events: Reports
281.article_body: Diljit Dosanjh and Arjun Rampal will reportedly share screen space in an upcoming film, which will be helmed by 'Raat Akeli Hai' director Honey Trehan. According to reports, Diljit will play an activist who'll fight for the victims of the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. It's being jointly produced by Ronnie Screwvala, Honey and Abhishek Chaubey, as per reports.

282.title: Major fire breaks out in Mumbai's Kanjurmarg area, no casualty reported
282.article_body: A "level-2 (major) fire" broke out on Monday afternoon in the NG Royal Park residential building located in Mumbai's Kanjurmarg (East), a fire official said. The fire was confined to the ninth and tenth floors of the building and there was no report of any casualty, the official added. Six fire engines, four jumbo tankers were rushed to the spot.

283.title: India's priority is to evacuate students, our priority is to stop war: Ukraine envoy
283.article_body: India's priority is to evacuate students, our priority is to stop the war and exert pressure on Russia, said Ukraine's Ambassador to India Igor Polikha. He added, "We are requesting all our foreign partners to exert pressure on Russian President Vladimir Putin to stop the war." The government is sending four Union Ministers to Ukraine's neighbouring countries to coordinate evacuation.

284.title: Mamata offers unconditional support to PM on Ukraine crisis, seeks all-party meet
284.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has written to PM Narendra Modi, offering her "unconditional support" amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis. Mamata also requested him to consider convening an all-party meeting. "In times of grave international crisis we keep aside our domestic disagreements to stand united as a nation...India must take lead to offer a peaceful solution to the world," she wrote.

285.title: Thought we'd be saved just like in movies, doesn't seem so now: Indian in Ukraine
285.article_body: Indian student Garima Mishra from UP appealed for help from the Indian government while being stranded amidst war in Ukraine, saying, "We used to see this in movies. We thought we would be saved." She added, "But now it doesn't seem like we will be saved...Please send someone by air to help us. Send the Indian Army."

286.title: Business with Russia means financing Hitler of 21st century: Ukraine Foreign Minister
286.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba took to Twitter to urge countries to cut all business ties with Russia. He wrote, "Making business with Russia today means financing aggression, war crimes, disinformation, cyberattacks and personally the Hitler of the 21st century named Vladimir Putin." The Ukraine-Russia war entered its fifth day today.

287.title: Dynasts can never make India capable: PM Narendra Modi
287.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said dynasts can never make India capable. "Dynasts can never make India capable, they can never make UP capable. Can these dynasts do anything?" PM Modi added. "During the COVID-19 period, they left no stone unturned to hurt the confidence of India. They tried to instigate the poor of the country against the indigenous vaccines," he stated.

288.title: Harshal bowling too many slower balls, Unadkat did the same: Rajkumar Sharma
288.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma has said India pacer Harshal Patel is bowling too many slower balls and needs to vary his deliveries. "Jaydev Unadkat was also doing the same, which made him predictable...Harshal needs to mix it up. He bowls the slower one really well," Rajkumar added. Harshal conceded 52 runs in the second Sri Lanka T20I.

289.title: Wrestler Ravi Dahiya wins gold at Yasar Dogu Ranking Series
289.article_body: Tokyo Olympics silver medallist wrestler Ravi Dahiya defeated Uzbekistan's Gulomjon Abdullaev 11-10 in the 61kg final to win gold in Yasar Dogu Ranking Series in Istanbul. Dahiya was trailing 8-10, but stood better in his last move in the final. Dahiya, who won the Olympics silver in men's freestyle 57kg, had lost to Abdullaev in Poland last year.

290.title: Ukrainian children appeal for help in video, say 'We are afraid, we want to live'
290.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share a video of children appealing to foreigners to save their lives in a video amid war with Russia. In the video, the children say that they are afraid and want to live. Russia's attack on Ukraine reached its fifth day today.

291.title: Ukraine man partially sinks Russian boss' ₹59-cr yacht, says 'No regrets' after arrest
291.article_body: A Ukrainian sailor in Spain was arrested after he partially sank his Russian boss' luxury yacht worth €7 million (around ₹59 crore). While he was later released, he said he didn’t regret his actions as his boss was a "criminal who sells weapons that kill the Ukrainian people". His boss had taken over a Russian state-owned weapons supplier in 2016.

292.title: Who is Madhabi Puri Buch, the first-ever woman to head SEBI?
292.article_body: Madhabi Puri Buch has been appointed as the first-ever woman Chairperson of SEBI. She was not only SEBI's first woman whole-time member but also the first person working at SEBI from the private sector. An IIM Ahmedabad alumna, Buch started her career with ICICI Bank, joined Greater Pacific Capital in Singapore and also served at New Development Bank in Shanghai.

293.title: Yami shares pics with kids from 'A Thursday', calls them 'cutest co-actors'
293.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam took to Instagram to share pictures with her children co-actors from the film 'A Thursday'. "Cutest co-actors I ever got to work with...Stepping in Naina's shoes was way more challenging than I had imagined while preparing for the part...But somewhere these little kids came in as a breather," she wrote.

294.title: Rohit is in the XI because of his batting, shouldn't lose focus: Saba
294.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper Saba Karim has said that Rohit Sharma shouldn't lose focus with the bat after being named Team India captain in all formats. "Rohit is in the XI because of his batting. Captaincy is an additional responsibility," he stated. "Lot of times we've seen...captains are not able to perform as well in their primary skill," he added.

295.title: Samantha shares article praising Ukraine President's courage amid invasion
295.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu on Monday took to Instagram to share an article praising Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's courage amid the Russian invasion. The article is titled 'A Prayer for Volodymyr Zelensky' and the excerpt read, "History has found the Ukrainian President and his courage is remarkable to witness." Several pictures of the Russian invasion have surfaced on social media.

296.title: Vidyut to host a show on martial arts, titled 'India's Ultimate Warrior'
296.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal is set to host a reality show exploring martial arts and combat skills, titled 'India's Ultimate Warrior'. The actor, who is trained in Kalaripayattu, an ancient martial art form that originated in Kerala, will find the "ultimate warrior, who has the right blend of physical and mental attributes like focus, control, determination, balance and discipline".

297.title: Virat Kohli should be opening the innings with Rohit Sharma: Hogg
297.article_body: Former Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Virat Kohli should open the innings along with skipper Rohit Sharma for India in the T20Is. "For me, if you're going to have Kohli in the team, he should be opening the batting with Rohit," Hogg stated. As an opener, Kohli has played eight T20I matches for India and has scored 278 runs.

298.title: 64-year-old Delhi man arrested for cheating 60 people of over ₹14 crore
298.article_body: A 64-year-old man has been arrested in Delhi for allegedly cheating over 60 people, including government and public sector employees, of over ₹14 crore by assuring them possession of a flat in a housing project in Greater Noida, police said. The accused, one of the directors of Shubhkamna Buildtech Pvt Ltd, had promised to deliver the project by 2013.

299.title: If Salman hates someone, the person will get to know: Pooja Hegde
299.article_body: Speaking about working with Salman Khan in 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', actress Pooja Hegde said he's a "real person". "He's very sweet...So it's...easy to communicate with someone like that," she added. "What I love about him is that if he loves you...he really does, you can tell that. And if he hates you, you can tell that too," Pooja said.

300.title: Opp'n tried to promote vaccine hesitancy by creating doubts: PM Modi
300.article_body: Opposition tried to promote vaccine hesitancy by creating doubts in the poor people's minds, said Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday. "Those Indians who felt proud by knowing that vaccines were Made in India were incited by the Opposition not to take the doses," PM Modi added. "Even the big countries...are far behind India in vaccination coverage today," he added.

301.title: Marathi actress reveals ATM details to cyber fraudsters, loses ₹1.48 lakh
301.article_body: A 64-year-old Marathi actress was cheated of ₹1.48 lakh after a text message from her telecom operator allegedly asked her to update her know your customer (KYC) details and added that her number will be blocked if she failed to do so. It asked her to reveal her ATM card details after which money from her bank account was withdrawn.

302.title: If they think I'll let down audience, I won't take money: Ronit on TV return
302.article_body: While talking about how one can convince him for a show, Actor Ronit Roy, who will be seen in show 'Swaran Ghar' said he looks for the story, if he finds it interesting and what is his part in the story. "But if they think I'm going to let down my audience, then I won't take the money," he added.

303.title: Bulgarian Defence Minister to be sacked for not calling Russian invasion a war
303.article_body: Bulgaria's Prime Minister Kiril Petkov has said he would sack Defence Minister Stefan Yanev for terming the Russian invasion of Ukraine as an operation and not war. "My Defence Minister cannot use the word 'operation' instead of 'war'. You cannot call it an operation when thousands of soldiers from the one and the other side are already killed," Petkov said.

304.title: Cong's Mekedatu padayatra is for political gains: K'taka CM
304.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said Congress' Mekedatu padayatra (foot march) demanding the implementation of the Mekedatu project across the Cauvery River is for political gains. Congress failed to even make Mekedatu's Detailed Project Report when they were in power, Bommai said. Congress resumed the padayatra on Sunday after temporarily stopping it in January amid rising COVID-19 cases.

305.title: BJP only party to confidently say we did what we promised: Nadda
305.article_body: BJP is the only party that can confidently say we did what we promised, JP Nadda, BJP chief said on Monday. "Earlier, children of poor (people) used to study under a lantern but now they are studying under full bright light as we have given 24 hours electricity," Nadda added while addressing a rally in Machhali Shahar, Jaunpur.

306.title: When I saw Bumrah, I wondered how he could bowl fast with his action: Shami
306.article_body: Talking about his relationship with pacer Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammad Shami recalled when he first saw the 28-year-old in the IPL. "It felt a bit strange seeing him because of his bowling action. I wondered how someone could bowl so fast with that action and where he got the power from," stated Shami, adding that Bumrah has "everything" in his bowling.

307.title: Man arrested for selling fake branded clothes in Hyderabad
307.article_body: A man accused of selling counterfeit versions of branded clothes in Hyderabad was arrested by Rachakonda Police on Saturday. The accused, identified as Sandi Satyapal Reddy, was nabbed by Special Operations Team (SOT) in LB Nagar zone. Fake garments worth over ₹2 lakh of brands including Louis Philippe and Allen Solly were also recovered from the accused's possession, police added.

308.title: War doesn't take sides, it causes loss of lives: Iulia on Russia-Ukraine crisis
308.article_body: Actor-model Iulia Vantur took to Instagram Stories to react to the Russia-Ukraine crisis. She wrote, "War does not take sides. It only causes loss of life and suffering." "My heart goes out to innocent lives lost in this war. The only side I am on is that may humanity choose peace against every option possible," she further wrote.

309.title: 'Shri Akhand Path Sahib' recited at Delhi gurdwara for well being of Indians in Ukraine
309.article_body: The Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (DSGMC) organised a 'Shri Akhand Path Sahib' (recital) of Guru Granth Sahib at Gurdwara Bangla Sahib for the well being of Indians stranded in Ukraine. "Government should ensure that our citizens don't face any problem there and they should be brought to India soon," Atma Singh Lubana, Vice President, DSGMC said.

310.title: Pune woman going to office killed after being hit by speeding vehicle
310.article_body: A 24-year-old woman riding a motorcycle was killed after being hit by a speeding vehicle in Pune's Bavdhan, police said. The woman, a resident of Sinhagad Road, was going to her office in Baner on February 25 when the incident took place. She had received major injuries, leading to her death, police added.

311.title: Man out on interim bail in murder case killed in South Delhi
311.article_body: A 28-year-old man, who was out of jail on an interim bail after being involved in a murder case, was shot dead by unidentified assailants in South Delhi on Monday. The deceased, Shivam Pandey, was lodged in the Tihar jail from 2016 to 2020. Police said they got call at 3 am about firing and that several bullets were fired.

312.title: Hrithik & Tiger don't stop practising until they've perfected a step: Dharmesh
312.article_body: Choreographer Dharmesh Yelande has said he really likes Hrithik Roshan and Tiger Shroff in terms of acting and dancing. "I've worked with them, and I've witnessed how particular they're about everything they do. They don't stop practising a particular step until it's perfect," he added. "Be it a hard step or an easy one, they perform everything with...perfection," said Dharmesh.

313.title: Don't want to give details on my wedding, it's nobody's business: Alia
313.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, who's reportedly in a relationship with actor Ranbir Kapoor, said that she likes to keep her private life guarded. "I don't want to give out details of when I'm getting married because it's nobody's business," she added. "But people are speculating and talking about it, now that there is something I can't do much about," Alia said.

314.title: No plans to play Spider-Man again, but no one believes me: Andrew
314.article_body: Actor Andrew Garfield, on being asked if he will portray Spider-Man again, said that there are no plans and "that's the truth". The actor further said, "Everyone's going to call me a liar for the rest of my life. I am the boy who cried wolf now." Andrew had earlier denied his appearance in Tom Holland-starrer 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.

315.title: I just want to see one left-arm bowler in Indian squad for T20 WC: Irfan
315.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said that he wants to see one left-arm fast bowler in the Indian squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "A left-arm bowler and that can be whoever performs in the IPL, Khaleel Ahmed, T Natarajan or Chetan Sakariya...Left is always right," he stated. ICC men's 2022 T20 World Cup will take place in October-November.

316.title: Ukrainians block movement of Russian tanks that stopped to seek directions
316.article_body: Hundreds of unarmed Ukrainian locals surrounded Russian tanks on the outskirts of Koryukivka in Ukraine after the Russian soldiers stopped to ask for directions on Monday. Videos of the incident showed Ukrainian men and women standing in front of the tanks and blocking their movement. A Ukrainian man was earlier filmed trying to block a Russian tank convoy.

317.title: What are the features of 'Mriya', world's largest plane destroyed by Russia in Ukraine?
317.article_body: Ukraine has said that the world's largest plane, Antonov An-225 'Mriya', was destroyed by Russian occupants on an airfield near Kyiv on Sunday. 'Mriya', which means "dream" in Ukrainian, is powered by six turbofan engines, has a wingspan of 290 feet, and a maximum payload weight of 2,50,000 kg. Only one An-225 was ever built by the Kiev-based Antonov company.

318.title: Those who troll on religion are not real Indians: Mohammad Shami
318.article_body: Talking about getting trolled after Pakistan's victory against India in T20 World Cup 2021, pacer Mohammad Shami said, "Those who troll on religion aren't real fans...nor are they real Indians." He added, "If you consider a player as hero and then behave this way...you aren't being an Indian supporter....I feel one shouldn't get hurt by comments made by such people."

319.title: I was advised to get breast implants at 18: Deepika Padukone
319.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone has revealed that the worst advice she ever received was to get breast implants. "I was all of 18 and I often wonder how I had the wisdom to not take it seriously," the actress said. Deepika had recounted this in an earlier interview as well, saying she was told it was the way to get recognised.

320.title: Ukrainian public figures targeted by 'Ghostwriter' hacking group: Meta
320.article_body: The social media accounts of a handful of Ukrainian public figures, including military officials and politicians, were compromised by a hacking group known as 'Ghostwriter', Meta said. The hackers attempted to post videos portraying Ukrainian troops as weakened. It added that it had separately disabled a network of fake accounts, groups and pages across Facebook and Instagram targeting Ukraine.

321.title: Mayank will lead Punjab Kings to successful IPL campaign: Kumble
321.article_body: After Mayank Agarwal was appointed as Punjab Kings captain, head coach Anil Kumble said he believes the opener will lead the franchise to a successful IPL campaign. "He is hardworking, enthusiastic, a team player with all the attributes required of a leader," Kumble added. With 441 runs from 12 matches, Mayank was the second-highest run-scorer for PBKS in IPL 2021.

322.title: Ukrainian woman soldier says 'I'm still alive, everything will be fine'; video viral
322.article_body: A video of a Ukrainian woman soldier has gone viral on social media, where she's saying, "I'm still alive, the sun is shining, the birds are singing...everything will be fine." The woman's identity and the original source of the video are unknown. Several people praised her courage while a tweet also read, "This is simultaneously so beautiful, and just heart-wrenching."

323.title: 42-yr-old tribal man flogged by police in J'khand; CM Soren orders inquiry
323.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren has ordered an inquiry after pictures of a 42-year-old tribal man, who was allegedly flogged by the police in Latehar district for "dropping off Maoists" in the forest area, surfaced on social media. The victim alleged he was beaten till he fell unconscious. "Jharkhand Police, take immediate cognisance of the matter," the CM tweeted.

324.title: How many nuclear weapons does Russia have in comparison to other countries?
324.article_body: As per the data released by the Arms Control Association, a US-based nonpartisan organisation, Russia has the highest number of nuclear weapons at 6,257, followed by the US which has 5,550 of them. They are followed by China (350), France (290), the UK (225), Pakistan (165), India (156), Israel (90) and North Korea (40-50). Notably, Ukraine has no nuclear weapons.

325.title: 10 students from Maharashtra return to Pune from Ukraine
325.article_body: A batch of 10 students stuck in Ukraine returned to Pune by a special Air India flight on Sunday. The students are from different parts of Maharashtra. On reaching Pune, a 20-year-old student said, "We are fortunate enough to come back safely to our country as the third batch of students there are now facing a lot of problems."

326.title: Delhi Police sets up e-kiosk for contactless complaint registration
326.article_body: A digital e-kiosk has been set up at Delhi's Parliament Street police station to improve the interface between the public and the police, officials said on Sunday. The e-kiosk will enable people to easily lodge complaints in a contactless mode, they added. "The kiosk is very easy to access and senior citizens can...use it easily," a senior official said.

327.title: Wanted table reservation, no one knew me; no one had watched my film: Adarsh
327.article_body: 'The White Tiger' actor Adarsh Gourav said he got a "reality check" when he had to reserve a table at restaurant on Valentine's Day. "Every place was booked out...Someone suggested we pull strings...I made calls...and no one had even watched the film. Eventually, one place knew me. They gave me a table, that's because they weren't sold out," he said.

328.title: Irfan Pathan trolls Ravindra Jadeja for blinking too much during press conference
328.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan trolled Ravindra Jadeja for blinking too much during a press conference. Commenting on a video of Jadeja's press conference, Irfan tweeted, "Baapu needs eye drops." Responding to Irfan, Jadeja said that he was wearing lenses for the very first time. Irfan then joked the way he is batting, it seems he is wearing binoculars.

329.title: Latvia allows its citizens to fight in Ukraine amid Russian invasion
329.article_body: Latvian parliament on Monday voted unanimously to allow nationals to fight in Ukraine if willing amid the Russian invasion of the country. "Citizens who want to support Ukraine and...serve there to defend Ukraine's independence and our common security must be able to do so," a Latvian politician said. This comes a day after Latvia shut its airspace to Russian planes.

330.title: Ragpicker killed in Hyd due to chemical explosion in garbage bin
330.article_body: A 40-year-old woman ragpicker was killed due to a chemical explosion while segregating trash at a garbage bin in Hyderabad's Anandnagar on Sunday, police said. "A plastic tin containing unknown chemical exploded...[The deceased's] left hand was severed due to...blast and she died on the spot,” police added. The victim's husband, who was also picking up trash, survived the mishap.

331.title: North Korea says latest missile launch was to test cameras for satellite
331.article_body: North Korea has claimed that its missile launch on Sunday was part of a test for the development of a reconnaissance satellite system. The test helped confirm "the characteristics and working accuracy of a high-definition photographing system, data transmission system and altitude control devices", reported state media. Two photos showing the Korean Peninsula from space were also released.

332.title: SC to hear Cyrus Mistry's appeal to drop its remarks against him in 10 days
332.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's appeal to expunge remarks made against him in the Court's 2021 verdict upholding Mistry's removal from the Tata Sons board. The plea said SC's remarks affect Mistry's "reputation, integrity and character". The Court said it will hear the plea in 10 days.

333.title: PM Modi is born in India to destroy demons, do welfare: Shivraj
333.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi was born in India to "destroy demons and for the welfare of people". "PM Modi...has decided to send four union ministers to ensure that every single Indian is evacuated safely from Ukraine," he said, adding, "It was due to PM Modi that vaccines were made in India."

334.title: We are ready for IPO but the markets aren't: MobiKwik Co-founder
334.article_body: MobiKwik will not be heading for its ₹1,900 crore IPO in this quarter, Co-founder Upasana Taku told Business Insider. Citing the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, Taku said, "I don't think it will be possible for any tech companies to IPO anytime soon." She added, "We're ready. Business performance is strong, SEBI approval is there. But the markets aren't ready."

335.title: Kangana calls herself 'real talent', says 'No mafia can beat honest work'
335.article_body: Rangoli Chandel took to Instagram to share a new still from her sister, Kangana Ranaut's upcoming film, 'Dhaakad'. Sharing the post, Rangoli wrote, "Hope Kangana...breaks her own records with Dhaakad this year." Reacting to it, Kangana wrote on her Instagram Stories, "It's a fight about me versus them. No mafia, no paid PR can beat real talent and honest work."

336.title: Huge traffic at B'luru-Mysuru road due to Cong's Mekedatu rally
336.article_body: As the Karnataka Congress resumed the Mekedatu rally, the Bengaluru-Mysuru road reported traffic congestion and people were advised to avoid the route. The march, which was suspended in January due to a surge in COVID-19 cases, will end at National College Grounds in Bengaluru. It is led by Congress' state chief DK Shivakumar and Leader of Opposition Siddaramaiah.

337.title: Harrison Ford's 'Indiana Jones 5' wraps production, to release in 2023
337.article_body: Harrison Ford-starrer 'Indiana Jones 5' has finished its production, the makers announced on Sunday. The fifth instalment in the 'Indiana Jones' franchise, directed by James Mangold, will also feature Phoebe Waller-Bridge, Thomas Kretschmann, Antonio Banderas and Mads Mikkelsen, among others. The action-adventure film is expected to release on June 30, 2023.

338.title: Why does Russian military equipment in Ukraine have a ‘Z’ symbol on them?
338.article_body: A military source in Ukraine said that the ‘Z’ marking along with other symbols are painted on Russian military vehicles so that they aren't confused with Ukrainian vehicles and the risk of friendly fire is reduced. Military experts also believe the symbols are likely to be connected to the geographic location of where the units would be deployed for combat.

339.title: 3 K'taka hijab case petitioners denied entry in college to attend practical exams
339.article_body: Three students were allegedly denied entry in Government PU College in Karnataka's Udupi to attend practical examinations on Monday. "The lecturer told me she'll accept my practical record book only if I remove my hijab," one of the students alleged. The three Class 12 science students are among six girls who have approached Karnataka High Court over the hijab row.

340.title: Infrastructure is biggest multiplier of investment: PM on PM Gati Shakti
340.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said the PM Gati Shakti initiative will not only lead to rapid infrastructure development but also generate employment. "Infrastructure is the biggest multiplier effect of investment. This also boosts the economic productivity of all other sectors," PM Modi added. Technology will play a major role in PM Gati Shakti, PM Modi stated.

341.title: Neighbours attack man in Guj, ask why he passes by their house daily
341.article_body: A 40-year-old man, Vali Meman, was allegedly attacked by his neighbours while he was out for his morning walk on Saturday in Ahmedabad. Meman said that his neighbour Annu and her son-in-law abused him and asked why he passed by her house every day. He said that his phone was also damaged when he tried to call the police.

342.title: Female Indian students picked up by Russian soldiers: Indian stuck in Ukraine
342.article_body: In a video shared by Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, an Indian student in Ukraine's Kyiv appealed for help, saying, "We've been surrounded from all sides." She said she was told by a friend that Russian soldiers fired at some Indian students who were trying to escape. "They (the soldiers) picked up just the girls," she said.

343.title: Russia further isolated from international financial system, Putin must fail: UK
343.article_body: UK's Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Monday said, "We've further isolated Russia from the international financial system this morning." He added, "Working with our partners, and the G7, we are determined to impose the most severe economic measures possible against Russian President Vladimir Putin for his abhorrent campaign against Ukraine." The UK PM also said, "Putin must fail."

344.title: Dalit RTI activist allegedly beaten, forced to drink urine in MP
344.article_body: Shashikant Jatav, a 33-year-old Dalit Right to Information (RTI) activist, was allegedly beaten up and forced to drink urine by seven people on February 23 in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. He was attacked after he sought information related to the Barhi village panchayat. Jatav was locked up in a room and allegedly thrashed. The accused also made casteist remarks against him.

345.title: Realise the scale of Ukrainian heroism: Ukraine on map comparing Ukraine, Russia's size
345.article_body: Ukraine's official Twitter account shared a map comparing Ukraine's size to Russia's, which read, "Realise the scale of Ukrainian heroism." Ukraine also tweeted, "Don't be afraid to stand up to evil, no matter how powerful it seems, at the dawn, the flag will still be there." Ukraine on Monday said Russian troops have slowed down "the pace of the offensive".

346.title: EU shuts its airspace to Russian planes, to send fighter jets to Ukraine amid war
346.article_body: The European Union has said it will purchase and deliver weapons to Ukraine, while also strengthening sanctions against Russia including closing its airspace to Russian planes and banning state-owned Russian media. The EU countries will also send fighter jets to Ukraine at Kyiv's request to help it counter the Russian air and land assault.

347.title: Old income tax regime with deductions must go: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj
347.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj has said that the old income tax regime must be disincentivised and the new regime must be incentivised with no exemptions. "The new regime will not take over unless we do so," Bajaj said. "What should the simple regime be? The simple regime should be broader tax slabs, lower taxes, no exemptions," he added.

348.title: We have been waiting for 6 years for this trophy: Shaheen on winning PSL 2022
348.article_body: Lahore Qalandars captain Shaheen Afridi thanked the fans and crowd after winning the seventh edition of the PSL on Sunday. "We have been waiting for six years...A lot of people supported me. The fight we showed as a team throughout the tournament is really fantastic," he added. Qalandars defeated Multan Sultans in the final to claim their maiden PSL trophy.

349.title: Norway wealth fund, world's largest, to divest its Russian assets
349.article_body:
