Norway's $1.3 trillion sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, will divest its Russian assets following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We have decided to freeze the fund's investments and have begun a process of selling out (of Russia)," Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Støre
 said. Norges Bank Investment Management's (NBIM) Russian assets were worth $2.83 billion at the end of 2021.

350.title: Ukraine sets up 'Come Back Alive' hotline for families of Russian soldiers
350.article_body: Ukraine has set up a hotline for the family members of the Russian soldiers. Called "Come Back Alive from Ukraine", the hotline has reportedly received hundreds of calls since the invasion began. Through this hotline, families can enquire if their relatives are alive, taken prisoner or how can they get the bodies of the deceased ones.

351.title: Madhabi Puri Buch appointed as first woman Chairperson of SEBI
351.article_body: The government on Monday appointed Madhabi Puri Buch as the first woman chairperson of market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for three years. Buch, a former SEBI Whole Time Member, will be replacing Ajay Tyagi whose tenure ends on February 28. Buch, who studied at IIM Ahmedabad, has previously worked at ICICI Bank and Greater Pacific Capital.

352.title: Benfica's Ukrainian footballer Yaremchuk breaks down after getting standing ovation
352.article_body: Portuguese football club Benfica's 26-year-old Ukrainian striker Roman Yaremchuk broke down after receiving a standing ovation from the entire stadium amid war in his home country. Yaremchuk was also handed the captain's armband after he came on to play in 62nd minute of their match against Vitória SC. Benfica shared a video, writing, "United!"

353.title: Non-violence is the only way: Dalai Lama on Russia-Ukraine war
353.article_body: Expressing anguish over war between Russia and Ukraine, Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama on Monday called for peace to prevail. "War is out-dated - non-violence is the only way," he said in a statement on his website. "Our world has become so interdependent that violent conflict between two countries inevitably impacts the rest of the world," he added.

354.title: Russia wants to reach agreement with Ukraine: Russian negotiator
354.article_body: Russia is interested in coming to an agreement that is in the interests of both sides at talks with Ukraine, Russian negotiator Vladimir Medinsky said on Monday. Russia started its "special military operation" in Ukraine on Thursday.  Earlier today, Russian military claimed air superiority in Ukraine and alleged that Ukraine was using civilians as human "shield".

355.title: Till death neither will people of Kashi nor will Kashi leave me: PM Modi
355.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said that neither the people of Kashi nor will Kashi leave him till his death. "When I was publicly wished for my death in Kashi, I felt very happy. Even my fiercest opponents are seeing how much love the people of Kashi have for me," PM Modi added while addressing a public rally in Varanasi.

356.title: Smriti Mandhana, who was hit on the head in warm-up match, cleared for WC
356.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana, who was hit on the head during their first warm-up fixture against South Africa on Sunday, will play in the Women's ODI World Cup 2022 after being cleared of any serious head injury. Mandhana did not feel any concussion symptoms but retired hurt as a precaution, according to the medical staff.

357.title: I would love a character, used mom's make-up to dress like that: Avantika
357.article_body: 'Mithya' actress Avantika Dassani said that she would dress like the character that she loved in childhood. "Every time I would watch a movie and fall in love with a character, I would dress up like that, raiding my parents' closets, getting into my mom's make-up, and getting myself yelled at for the mess that I created," she added.

358.title: Selena trips in her heels at SAG Awards 2022; went on the stage barefoot
358.article_body: Singer-actor Selena Gomez, on Monday, tripped while walking the red carpet at SAG Awards 2022. A video surfaced on the internet in which Selena can be seen tripping in front of photographers in her black high heels. Post the incident, Selena seemingly decided to go barefoot to the stage. After seeing the video, her fans praised Selena for going barefoot.

359.title: It's for safety of your citizens you should vote to stop war: Ukraine as India abstained
359.article_body: After the UNSC voted on draft resolution deploring Russian invasion in Ukraine, Ukraine appeared to refer to India and said, "It's for the safety of your nationals in Ukraine that you should be the first to vote to stop the war." India abstained from voting, saying, it's concerned about the security of the Indian community including Indian students in Ukraine.

360.title: 3 employees of CNG pump in Gurugram hacked to death by armed miscreants
360.article_body: Three employees of a CNG pump in Gurugram's Sector 31 were hacked to death, police said. The deceased, all natives of Uttar Pradesh, were attacked with sharp weapons, police added. Police suspect robbery to be the motive behind the crime. A search has been launched to arrest the miscreants. An FIR is yet to be registered in the matter.

361.title: Russia forced to acknowledge suffering casualties for first time: UK on Ukraine invasion
361.article_body: UK's Ministry of Defence has shared the latest defence intelligence update on Ukraine. "Logistical failures and staunch Ukrainian resistance continue to frustrate the Russian advance," it said. It added, "Despite continued attempts to suppress details of the conflict from the Russian population, the Russian Armed Forces has for the first time been forced to acknowledge suffering casualties."

362.title: Salman Khan fails to perform 'Jumme Ki Raat' step with Pooja, video surfaces
362.article_body: Salman Khan tried to reenact a step from his song 'Jumme Ki Raat' with Pooja Hegde on stage during their Da-bangg tour in Dubai recently. However, he was unable to do the hook step as she was wearing a short bodycon dress. In the original song, which also featured Jacqueline Fernandez, Salman lifted her coat with his teeth and danced.

363.title: Kangana Ranaut's spy thriller 'Dhaakad' to release on May 27
363.article_body: Kangana Ranaut-starrer 'Dhaakad' is set to release in theatres on May 27. "The unstoppable force of #AgentAgni is fast approaching," Kangana wrote while announcing the release date. The spy thriller will hit the screens in four languages, including Hindi, Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam. Directed by Razneesh Ghai, 'Dhaakad' will also feature Arjun Rampal and Divya Dutta.

364.title: Shibani is Farhan's 'problem now', jokes Rhea; shares pic from their wedding
364.article_body: Rhea Chakraborty, on Sunday, shared a picture from Farhan Akhtar and Shibani Dandekar's wedding on her Instagram handle. "Mr and Mrs Akhtar, love is contagious, thank you for spreading so much love," she wrote, adding, "Shibani, you make the most beautiful bride in the world, I love you to moon and back. Farhan, she's your problem now, all the best."

365.title: Anti-war coalition in action: Ukraine Prez after talks with UK, Poland
365.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that an anti-war coalition was coming into action against the "aggressor" Russia after holding talks with UK PM Boris Johnson and Poland President Andrzej Duda. "Agreed on further joint steps to counter the aggressor. Anti-war coalition in action!" tweeted Zelenskyy. Johnson said he would do everything possible to provide defensive aid to Ukraine.

366.title: Maha cyber fraud victim calls helpline, asked to call in office hrs
366.article_body: A 47-year-old farmer from Maharashtra called the national helpline to report a cyber fraud that he was a victim of but was allegedly told to call "during office hours". "I called helpline number 1930 and narrated incident...man on helpline replied...their office was closed...asked me to call next day. I went to the police station the next day," farmer told police.

367.title: Russian troops have slowed down pace of the offensive: Ukraine
367.article_body: The Ukrainian military today said that Russian troops have slowed the pace of the offensive with their assault against Ukraine entering into its fifth day. The Ukrainian military added that Russian troops, however, are still trying to develop success in some areas. Ukraine on Sunday night claimed that it has killed and wounded over 4,300 Russian soldiers.

368.title: Russian central bank raises key interest rate to 20% from 9.5%
368.article_body: The Russian central bank on Monday raised its key interest rate to 20% from 9.5% to counter risks of rouble depreciation and higher inflation. Russia has also ordered companies to sell 80% of their foreign currency revenues. Several other measures were also announced by the bank to support domestic markets amid harsh Western sanctions.

369.title: Pune man gets 15-year jail for raping minor niece for 2 years
369.article_body: A 38-year-old man from Pune was sentenced to 15 years in jail for raping his minor niece for two years, while his wife was found guilty of hiding the crime. The man had offered shelter to the victim and her younger sister after their father died. The younger sister was also reportedly sexually harassed by their cousin.

370.title: Mayank Agarwal appointed captain of Punjab Kings
370.article_body: Mayank Agarwal has officially been named captain of Punjab Kings ahead of IPL 2022. "I've been at Punjab Kings since 2018 and I take a lot of pride in representing this fantastic unit. I'm delighted to be given the opportunity," Agarwal said. He added, "My job would be made easier with...talent we have in the Punjab Kings squad this season."

371.title: BJP workers clash with police in WB's Balurghat amid 12-hr 'bandh' call
371.article_body: BJP workers on Monday clashed with police personnel in West Bengal's Balurghat during protests against alleged violence in the state's civic polls. "Our workers were protesting peacefully, they are beaten up. Police are playing the role of a cadre for TMC, this is against democracy," WB BJP chief, Sukanta Majumdar said. BJP called for a 12-hour statewide bandh today.

372.title: India asks its citizens in Ukraine to move to Western parts as Kyiv lifts weekend curfew
372.article_body: Indian Embassy in Ukraine has asked all Indian students in the Ukrainian capital Kyiv to make their way to the railway station for onward journey to the western parts as weekend curfew has been lifted in Kyiv. "Ukraine Railways is putting special trains for evacuations," the Embassy tweeted. Around 16,000 Indian students are reported to be stranded in war-ridden Ukraine.

373.title: 4 new judges take oath of office in Delhi High Court; strength rises to 34
373.article_body: Delhi High Court Chief Justice DN Patel on Monday administered the oath of office to four new judges of the high court, including a woman. The new judges are Justice Neena Bansal Krishna, Justice Dinesh Kumar Sharma, Justice Anoop Kumar Mendiratta and Justice Sudhir Kumar Jain. The new appointments take the number of judges in Delhi HC to 34.

374.title: Want to go, my family needs me; it's dangerous: Ukraine citizen in India
374.article_body: A citizen of Ukraine in India said that she wants to go to Ukraine capital Kyiv. "I want to go to Kyiv as my family needs me in Ukraine. People can't buy food there as bombing is happening. So a dangerous situation out there," she said. Ukrainian nationals in India are reportedly approaching Ukrainian Embassy in Delhi regarding their families.

375.title: Sunday was tough: Ukraine military amid ‘continuous shelling from Russians’
375.article_body: The General Staff of Ukraine's Armed Forces said that Sunday was difficult for its forces as the Russian military continued "shelling in almost all directions". "The Air Force confronts the aggressor both in the sky and on the ground," it said on Facebook. It added that the Ukrainian forces managed to hold control over the aviation garrison in Vasylkiv.

376.title: RCB don't have batting depth, but bowling department is sensational: Hogg
376.article_body: During a question-answer session, ex-Australia cricketer Brad Hogg was asked about RCB's squad for IPL 2022. He responded, "They don't have that batting depth. They're going in with the same problems they had in the previous years...But their bowling department is sensational." He added, "Having Faf du Plessis with Virat Kohli is a better opening partnership."

377.title: Did riyaaz with him, not a day spent without missing: Sajid's daughter on Wajid
377.article_body: Muskaan Khan, daughter of music composer Sajid Khan, of the duo Sajid-Wajid, said that she used to do "riyaaz" with her late uncle Wajid Khan. "I used to watch...chacha Wajid do so much riyaaz...He had a guitar...and kept composing...I would do riyaaz with Wajid chacha...I don't think there is one day we can spend without missing him," she added.

378.title: Kohli can't be replaced at no. 3, Shreyas can bat at 4 or 5 in T20Is: Gavaskar
378.article_body: After India batter Shreyas Iyer scored 204 runs against Sri Lanka while batting at the number three position, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said Virat Kohli remains irreplaceable at the position and Iyer will have to be slotted in at number four or five along with Suryakumar Yadav. "Top-batting line-up allows you to go in with pure bowlers," he added.

379.title: Indian students harassed by Ukraine soldiers after India abstains from UN vote
379.article_body: Indian students are allegedly harassed and beaten by Ukrainian officials at Poland border. A video shows Ukrainian soldiers firing in the air and forcing Indians back into Ukraine. Some students complained that they were kept in a hostage-like situation in the freezing cold and denied water and food. Notably, India twice abstained from voting at the UN on Ukraine crisis.

380.title: Russian vodka thrown out of several liquor stores in US, Canada; videos surface
380.article_body: Liquor stores across the US and Canada have been throwing out their Russian vodka stocks in a show of protest against Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Several videos of liquor store and bar owners emptying out their bottles and taking stocks off the shelves were widely shared on social media. Government officials in Canada's Ontario directed stores to remove Russian vodka.

381.title: Imposing marriage age on girls might not yield desired results: RSS women wing
381.article_body: RSS' women wing, Rashtriya Sevika Samiti, on Sunday said that girls should marry after getting proper education but suggested that "imposing" a marriage age might not yield desired results. "Such issues are better to be dealt with public awareness and holding wider discussions," Rashtriya Sevika Samiti's Sunila Sohwani said.

382.title: Video shows Indian students being beaten on Ukraine border
382.article_body: A video has been widely shared on social media showing Indian students being beaten on the Ukraine border. In the video, guards in uniforms can be seen manhandling students, including girls. Some students can also be seen screaming while pinned to the ground by the guards. Several Indians stuck in Ukraine have alleged they have been stopped from crossing borders.

383.title: Singer Mika Singh to have a swayamwar on national television: Reports
383.article_body: Singer Mika Singh will reportedly have his swayamwar on national television. According to reports, it'll be aired in a few months and Mika will not actually get married on the show. Instead, he'll only get engaged with the contestant whom he'd find the best. Women from all over the country will be allowed to participate in the swayamwar, reports added.

384.title: Will Smith wins Best Actor at SAG Awards, Jessica Chastain bags Best Actress
384.article_body: Will Smith bagged 'Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Leading Role' at 28th Screen Actors Guild Awards (SAG) for his performance in 'King Richard'. The award for 'Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Leading Role' went to Jessica Chastain for the film 'The Eyes of Tammy Faye'. The ceremony was held in California on February 27.

385.title: Russia's ruble falls 30% against US dollar amid sanctions over Ukraine invasion
385.article_body: Russia's ruble plunged nearly 30% against the dollar on Monday after world powers imposed sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. The ruble was indicated to be down 27% at 114.33 per dollar in offshore trading, according to Bloomberg News. The US and European Union said they would exclude some Russian banks from the international bank payments system SWIFT.

386.title: Heroin worth ₹56 crore seized from South African national at Mumbai airport
386.article_body: The Air Intelligence Unit of Mumbai Customs arrested a South African national for allegedly trying to smuggle eight kilograms of heroin worth ₹56 crore inside his luggage. "The seized NDPS substance...was concealed inside two small trolley bags and a handbag," an official said. The man had arrived at Mumbai airport from Johannesburg via Kigali.

387.title: India to send 4 ministers to Ukraine's neighbouring countries for evacuation of Indians
387.article_body: Union Ministers Hardeep Singh Puri, Jyotiraditya Scindia, Kiren Rijiju and Gen (Retd) VK Singh will be sent to neighbouring countries of Ukraine as Special Envoys of India. They will personally oversee the evacuation of Indians at the border areas. The decision was taken during a high-level meeting chaired by PM Narendra Modi today to discuss the Ukraine crisis.

388.title: ITBP Himveers play volleyball at 15,000 feet in -20°C, video surfaces
388.article_body: Indo-Tibetan Border Police took to Twitter to share a video of the Himveers playing volleyball in snow-clad area of Uttarakhand. "How is the Josh...Very high...Himveers of ITBP playing volleyball at 15,000 feet at a Border Out Post in Uttarakhand...Temperature around is minus 20 degree celsius," ITBP wrote on Twitter. In another video, Himveers can be seen patrolling at 14,000 feet.

389.title: He's selfless, wants each scene to be best: Vaani on Shamshera co-star Ranbir
389.article_body: Vaani Kapoor, sharing her experience of working with Ranbir Kapoor in the upcoming film 'Shamshera', said, "[He's] a pleasure to work with because he brings so much work ethic to the table." "He's...a selfless actor who wants to creatively collaborate so that each scene turns out to be the best," she added. 'Shamshera' is slated to release on July 22.

390.title: Death toll from earthquake in Indonesia reaches 11; rescue op on
390.article_body: The death toll due to the 6.2-magnitude earthquake which struck Indonesia on Friday climbed up to 11 on Sunday after rescuers recovered more bodies. The National Disaster Mitigation Agency spokesperson said that six people died in the Pasaman district, while five in the neighbouring West Pasaman. The rescuers are searching for four villagers that possibly got buried in rubble.

391.title: 7 named in FIR for raising 'Pakistan zindabad' slogans in UP's Prayagraj
391.article_body: Police have booked seven identified persons and several other unidentified people for allegedly raising "Pakistan zindabad" slogans in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. "During preliminary inquiry, it has come to light that the persons named in the FIR are associated with the Samajwadi Party," Handia SHO said. "Police are trying to frame our party workers in false cases," Prayagraj SP chief said.

392.title: Woman scares people with cobra to extract money, police launches hunt
392.article_body: Tamil Nadu police are on a look out for a woman who allegedly scared people with a cobra to extract money from them. The police have filed a suo motu case against the woman after a video of her with cobra reportedly went viral. An officer said woman appeared to be nomad and snake charmer.

393.title: You're using Alia's name for attention: Payal Rohatgi to Kangana
393.article_body: According to the format of 'Lock Upp', actress Payal Rohatgi was given a set of charges, where she was supposed to defend herself. Payal was told by the show's host Kangana Ranaut that she cashes in on others' controversies for the sake of publicity. Reacting to it, Payal said, "I can also say...[You are using] Alia Bhatt's name...for...grabbing attention."

394.title: Australia to send lethal military weapons to help Ukraine in war
394.article_body: The Australian government on Monday announced that it will send lethal military equipment to Ukraine to help the country defend itself against the Russian attack. The details of the equipment consignment were not immediately known. This comes days after the country pledged non-lethal military equipment, medical supplies and financial aid to Ukraine amid the ongoing war.

395.title: 352 civilians including 14 children killed in Ukraine amid Russia's invasion
395.article_body: Ukraine's Health Ministry has informed that 352 civilians, including 14 children, have been killed since the beginning of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Ukraine added that 1,684 people, including 116 children, have been wounded. While Russia claimed that its troops are targeting only Ukrainian military facilities, Ukraine said that Russia was lying about not shelling civilian infrastructure.

396.title: It inspired me a million times: Kili Paul after PM Modi's mention
396.article_body: Instagram sensation Kili Paul, who went viral for lip-syncing to Indian film songs, said it "inspired him a million times" after India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi mentioned him and his sister Neema Paul on his show Mann Ki Baat. Taking to Instagram, Kili Paul wrote, "Thank you, sir @narendramodi. I'm so mind blown to wake up to such beautiful news."

397.title: BJP calls for 12-hr bandh to protest against violence during WB civic polls
397.article_body: The BJP has called for a 12-hour statewide bandh in West Bengal on Monday in protest against alleged rigging and violence during the state’s civic polls. BJP spokesperson Samik Bhattacharya said the shutdown from 6 am to 6 pm will exempt essential services. "The elections have been reduced to a farce by the ruling party miscreants,"  Bhattacharya added.

398.title: Samson obviously hasn't grabbed his opportunities: Jaffer
398.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said he feels sad to see Sanju Samson not "grabbing his opportunities" in the three-match T20I series against Sri Lanka. "Samson does show the glimpse of what he can do but just doesn't take the opportunity that other guys have taken," Jaffer added. Samson batted in the final two T20Is and scored 39(25) and 18(12).

399.title: 66-year-old surgeon shot at in UP's Bareilly, one detained
399.article_body: One person was detained after a 66-year-old surgeon and the chancellor of a private university was allegedly shot at while he was returning home from his hospital in Bareilly on Saturday. The victim, Dr Keshav Kumar Agarwal, had stopped at a temple on his way home when he was attacked by a group of men, according to the police.

400.title: Whom did Rohit Sharma give the trophy just after winning the T20I series against SL?
400.article_body: Just after collecting the trophy after winning the T20I series against Sri Lanka, India captain Rohit Sharma handed over the trophy to Jaydev Shah and asked him to join the players for a group photo. Jaydev was the BCCI representative for the series. He is the former captain of Saurashtra and son of former BCCI Secretary Niranjan Shah.
